title: Fibreop Ping
body:
Hello. I am from New Brunswick, Canada and have had a decently steady 39 Ping ever since the server moved to Chicago. As of the last few weeks I noticed that I am now hovering around 55 ping. Now, I'm not whining over it saying that it's unplayable, I am just curious if anyone else has noticed/experienced the same thing as me, and maybe some fix is available for it? Also, I have Bell Aliant/FibreOp, if that helps for who are wondering. It could be a me thing, could be for people that have FibreOp, I don't know.

~Cheers

replies.body:
I had a ping of 42 since the change of servers but as of recently I've steadily noticed the ping climb. I'm now consistently 58-60 on the ping where as before it was lower. A jump of nearly 20ms without any reasonable explanation is kind of scary to be honest. Either Bell has started to do a different hop to Riot's servers or Riot changed something recently. 

I'm in Nova Scotia, on Bell FibreOp as well. 200mb down/75mb up.

It gets worse the further you are. I'm from the caribbean and after the eastern move of the server i got between 70-80 ping. It climbed to 100, 110, 130-140. It seems to be a problem with how FibreOp networks are routed as they take A LOT of unnecessary roundabout routes. However the thing is this only happens with League. I play a few other online games and my ping for those lie between 60-85 ping, nothing else seems to be affected so harshly by the FibreOp.
Strange. If more say that they notice this too and they are with FibreOp then I think that may be the problem.
I live in Freddy aswell and I was at a steady 39-42 ping and I'm at 55-60 now aswell as of the last two weeks
Do you have FibreOp as well?
hmmm. Maybe it is FirbeOp then
I just called and they said they cant do anything about it cause they dont deal with game servers >.<
I wish their was somthing FibreOp/Riot could do but I doubt it...
there is no reason why we should have the same ping as half of california after the server move and my ping keeps spiking every 5 minutes to 200+ it's just stupid
Yeah mine spikes like that too. It's just sad.
GREAT NEWS, My ping has finally dropped back to its 70-80 range. Any change for anyone else?
Lucky you! D: I'm still experiencing the crazy 220 ping lmfao. i want it back to 160 :(

sorry to hear that, thought since the people in those post had similar problems that theirs would be fixed as well. Especially since i'm in the Caribbean so i thought if the fix extended to me then most of the eastern NA wouldn't have any problem.
Well, I live in Israel so i'm not sure it's relevant LOL
lol kk, well that may be actually good news if my initial theory was right, would probably just have to wait a bit longer.
Has your ping gotten any better? mine hasn't :/

Nope. Well, kinda. It could be that I now have my built gaming PC and have an Ethernet connected, at least with that, I now have constant 50, no more, no less.

EDIT: And it appears that the random spikes of ping have stopped since I got the PC/Ethernet connection
